html: Last month my legislation, the Delta National Heritage Area Act, was signed into law. This legislation establishes the Delta as the first National Heritage Area in California’s history and provides $10 million for community-based efforts to conserve the Delta’s cultural heritage.

html: I want to ensure that those in charge of military housing are held accountable for the safety and wellbeing of servicemembers and their families.

html: I want to ensure military families have access to the best possible living conditions. Sadly, that hasn’t always been the case, and I convened this hearing to ensure the Department of Defense is taking appropriate measures to address these issues.

html: Climate change presents a myriad of readiness challenges both at home and abroad. It is not only a future threat but is impacting resiliency of our installations and operations today. The Department must act now to address these challenges.

html: Not only are these climate-related events impacting installation readiness, but they are also creating more frequent requests for military support for disaster relief and humanitarian assistance.

text: I won't allow this President's draconian budget request become law. Instead, I will fight to repair our roads, protect our environment, and expand opportunities for local farmers to ensure our government works #ForThePeople again.

html: Page 93: The budget requests a $2.8 billion or 31-percent decrease from the @EPA. Removing harmful pollutants and toxins from our air and water supply simply isn't a priority for this President.
text: Page 93: The budget requests a $2.8 billion or 31-percent decrease from the @EPA. Removing harmful pollutants and toxins from our air and water supply simply isn't a priority for this President.

html: Page 77: The budget requests a $5.9 billion or 22-percent decrease in the Department of Transportation's budget. That's less money to repair our roads, bridges, and other crucial projects in and around our community.
text: Page 77: The budget requests a $5.9 billion or 22-percent decrease in the Department of Transportation's budget. That's less money to repair our roads, bridges, and other crucial projects in and around our community.

html: Page 57: The budget requests a $2 billion or 14-percent decrease from the Department of the Interior (including 2019 changes in mandatory programs). That could impact the Berryessa Snow Mountain in our district.
text: Page 57: The budget requests a $2 billion or 14-percent decrease from the Department of the Interior (including 2019 changes in mandatory programs). That could impact the Berryessa Snow Mountain in our district.

html: Page 15: The 2020 budget requests a $3.6 billion or 15-percent cut to @USDA (including changes in mandatory programs and receipts). That would take money directly from our large agriculture community in the 3rd District.

html: 5/5 We stand with every American that has become a victim to violent prejudice and reaffirm our commitment to pursue a fair and just society. We clearly have work to do, but tonight was a reminder that no one will break the spirit of unity and acceptance in our community.
text: 5/5 We stand with every American that has become a victim to violent prejudice and reaffirm our commitment to pursue a fair and just society. We clearly have work to do, but tonight was a reminder that no one will break the spirit of unity and acceptance in our community.

html: 4/5 we will never lose hope and will always maintain faith that America is a nation of acceptance and tolerance instead of division and fear. We gathered in defiance of villainy and those that seek to marginalize members of our community.
text: 4/5 we will never lose hope and will always maintain faith that America is a nation of acceptance and tolerance instead of division and fear. We gathered in defiance of villainy and those that seek to marginalize members of our community.

html: 3/5 Tonight, we gathered to stand in solidarity with the Jewish community and to send a clear message to those who wish to take advantage of our nation's current cultural and political divide:
text: 3/5 Tonight, we gathered to stand in solidarity with the Jewish community and to send a clear message to those who wish to take advantage of our nation's current cultural and political divide:

html: 2/5 As our nation becomes increasingly divided by the actions of bigoted and racist individuals, we must use our voices to speak out and show that love and unity will always outlast hatred and fear.
text: 2/5 As our nation becomes increasingly divided by the actions of bigoted and racist individuals, we must use our voices to speak out and show that love and unity will always outlast hatred and fear.

text:
Thank you to @RepAdamSmith, @TedLieu, @RepGaramendi, @repblumenauer and @SenMarkey, for introducing legislation to stop building new, “low-yield” nuclear weapons. 
https://lieu.house.gov/sites/lieu.house.gov/files/LIEU_096_xml.pdf …

html: Low-yield nuclear weapons have the potential to lower the threshold for using nuclear weapons & increase the risk of entering the U.S. into nuclear war. That's why we've introduced the Hold the LYNE Act to permanently ban the development of these weapons. https://bit.ly/2OApVwr pic.twitter.com/tAekf59F6u
text: Low-yield nuclear weapons have the potential to lower the threshold for using nuclear weapons & increase the risk of entering the U.S. into nuclear war. html: I believe Judge Kavanaugh's confirmation vote cannot proceed until a thorough investigation into Dr. Ford's allegation has been completed. Therefore, I will be sending a formal request to the Senate Judiciary Committee today calling for a delay in Judge Kavanaugh's nomination.
text:
I believe Judge Kavanaugh's confirmation vote cannot proceed until a thorough investigation into Dr. Ford's allegation has been completed.

Therefore, I will be sending a formal request to the Senate Judiciary Committee today calling for a delay in Judge Kavanaugh's nomination.

html: 4/4 The Merchant Mariners had the highest casualty rate of all branches of our armed forces, yet it took until 1988 for them to get veteran status. This country still has not recognized their bravery, and I’m very pleased at the broad support in Congress to change that.
text: 4/4 The Merchant Mariners had the highest casualty rate of all branches of our armed forces, yet it took until 1988 for them to get veteran status. This country still has not recognized their bravery, and I’m very pleased at the broad support in Congress to change that.

html: 3/4 An estimated 8,300 mariners lost their lives in the war effort, and another 12,000 were wounded, to ensure our servicemembers had the resource they needed to keep up the fight.
text: 3/4 An estimated 8,300 mariners lost their lives in the war effort, and another 12,000 were wounded, to ensure our servicemembers had the resource they needed to keep up the fight.

html: 2/4 The goal of this legislation is simple: award a Congressional Gold Medal, one of the highest honors in the United States, to Merchant Mariners who sustained our armed forces during WWII.
text: 2/4 The goal of this legislation is simple: award a Congressional Gold Medal, one of the highest honors in the United States, to Merchant Mariners who sustained our armed forces during WWII.

html: 1/4 I'm proud that my bill to honor our nation's Merchant Marine veterans from World War II has garnered 103 co-sponsors in the House of Representatives.https://patch.com/california/dixon/announcements/a/45540/rep-garamendi-s-world-war-ii-merchant-marine-congressional-gold-medal-act-earns-103-co-sponsors …
